fields.name: CSL VM Server Maintenance
fields.content: All - there will be maintenance on two of the CSL VM Servers necessitating a reboot tomorrow, July 30th, around 2PM. The following systems will experience a short outage while the server they are on is shut down and rebooted:   TJ Remote Access Server (remote.tjhsst.edu) Iodine Mysql Database Server   Total downtime for each system should be less than 30 minutes.  If you have any questions, please email sysadmins@lists.tjhsst.edu or ahamilto@tjhsst.edu. Thank you in advance for your patience. Andrew Hamilton TJ IT

fields.name: Summer Assignments
fields.content: Congratulations on another great school year! As we prepare for the next school year, please make sure you refer to the following website for assignments that should be completed prior to the start of next school year:       http://www.tjhsst.edu/summer-assignments.php   One assignment for all students is to read the book, “Drive: The surprising Truth About What Motivates Us” by Daniel H. Pink to begin thinking about the 2013-2014 One Question selected by the TJ students and teachers, “How can we maintain a passion for learning in a school system where a pronounced emphasis on achieving good grades has a tendency to reduce genuine interest in gaining a deeper understanding of subject material?”    Contact information for each assignment is posted to the website.

fields.name: Important Dates for Students
fields.content: Student Accounts ·         Seniors will lose all FCPS Network, Blackboard, and Google account access within a week of graduation.  Seniors need to back up any information you want BEFORE that happens.  Deleted information will NOT be recoverable. ·         Underclassmen will lose all FCPS Network items but will retain Blackboard and Google.  There will be forced password resets in August.  If you forget your Google password over the summer, you MUST come into an FCPS building to reset it.  It cannot be reset from home. Blackboard·         June 24 - Courses will be made unavailable·         Aug 15 - Forced password changes will happen for all staff and students (not parents)Online Textbooks·         Access to the online textbooks will be available to students for the grade level that they are currently assigned until August 9, the last day of summer school.  As of the 9th, all student accounts will be cleared out in preparation for teachers to reassign students to the next grade level text.

fields.name: Important Facts for Summer Researchers
fields.content: Planning to conduct research this summer?  Work at a mentorship site?  Develop a computer/math project?  Participate in a SEAP/NIH program?  Attend a university-sponsored research program?  Then, NOW is the time to begin your Science Fair paperwork and to arrange for a TJ teacher sponsor for your project.  Remember almost ALL paperwork must be signed and dated PRIOR to the start of experimentation.  Check Blackboard, "TJ Science & Engineering Fair" organization for a how-to guide to completing this paperwork.  We strongly recommend that even those researchers not sure about participating in Science Fair complete their paperwork.  Questions?  Please see Mrs. Luxenberg in Rm 121W prior to the end of school.

fields.name: Senior Workshop Offering, June 3rd
fields.content: Your University’s Library:  You’ve outgrown your high school library.  But you don’t want to be a time-wasting loser without a life just because you are overwhelmed by the library where you’re headed.  What do you need to know about the library of your university so that you can get a strong start on research there?  Come to this June 3rd Senior Workshop 8th period to get the top 5 tips for effectively using the library of the university to which you are headed.  You’ll arrive knowing more confident than 99% of the other freshmen — it’s a promise!

fields.name: tjSTAR Tech Reminder
fields.content: TJStar is this Wednesday! This is a reminder to please have your presentation available in multiple locations. Some good choices are your M: drive and your UNIX filesystem, both available through intranet, as well as a USB drive. Also, on TJStar Day, please access your files through Intranet instead of logging out the computer and logging back in as this will be much faster.  If you are relying on wireless access on TJSTAR, please make sure that your device is configured to access the FCPSmobile network. Due to the large number of additional guests in the building, it is highly likely that the FCPS network will become congested and may be difficult to access. If your presentation relies on any multimedia files, please try to download them beforehand in case Internet access is slow.  Finally, if you are planning on presenting using your own computer during tjSTAR, please note that most of our projectors only have VGA ports for connecting computers. If your laptop does not have a VGA output, please email Andrew Hamilton immediately to verify the capabilities of the projector where you will be presenting.  If you have any last minute tech questions, please email ahamilto@tjhsst.edu.

fields.name: What is the REAL Islam?
fields.content: Have you ever wondered why Muslims are offended when there are pictures of the Prophet Muhammad? Do you know why Muslim women wear the hijab? Is there a male equivalent? What exactly is Sharia law? Why can't Muslims eat pork? Why did Islam gain so many believers so quickly?Come to MSA this Friday to learn the answers to all these questions and much much more!!There will be FOOD!!! :)
fields.author: Ethan Alexander Lowman

fields.name: Technological Solutions to Human Trafficking
fields.content: Think the 13th amendment ended slavery? Don’t be so sure: human trafficking is still happening all over the world. Jefferson graduate Kwamina Orleans-Pobee recently won first place at a global competition, the Campus Challenge to Combat Human Trafficking, for his work in finding creative technology solutions for human trafficking issues. Come hear him speak about human trafficking and technological solutions this Friday! Sign up for the special this Friday A block. Refreshments will be provided!

In order to facilitate this process, we greatly appreciate an essay submissions. ***The submission deadline for essays is April 1. Please email us at tj.thiswebelieve@gmail.com for a link to the submission form, or if you have any questions. Here are some tips from This I Believe Inc.:Please limit your essay to approximately 500 words. Tell a story that illustrates how your personal belief was shaped. Please refrain from writing an opinion piece about a public issue. We want the story of your belief, not an editorial about a current event. Tell us what you do believe, not what you don’t believe. Read essay-writing guidelines from the organization: http://thisibelieve.org/guideline

fields.name: Cyber Security Tips from FBLA
fields.content: Hey TJ, we’re the FBLA team going to the 2013 High School Academic Business Competition at UVA, and we have some tips on the dangers of cyber-security, and how to be safer.One really big danger is having a simple password.  If your password is six characters, it will only take hackers about ten minutes to hack it.  But if you add a few letters, numbers or symbols, it may take them years to get into your account.Another danger is phishing.  Phishing is the name for when a hacker tricks you into giving them information about your bank (or other) accounts.  It’s always best to double check the link you click on.  Here is a fun quiz to see if you are likely to fall prey to a phishing scam:  http://www.sonicwall.com/furl/phishing/Yeah, we all think that it’ll happen to someone else, but did you know that 73% of Americans have been a victim of cybercrime?  Are you?

fields.name: Academic Integrity
fields.content: There is a new form for students to submit to report Honor Violations. This form should be used to report integrity violations that you as an individual witness or of which you have first-hand knowledge. It is submitted to the TJ Administration. This document is not anonymous, but is confidential. Your name will not be used, nor will the discussion of consequences. It is the intent of the school to minimize cheating and dishonesty.  To view and submit the form, you must log in through your Google Apps account (studentID@fcpsschools.net). If you have not activated your FCPS Google Apps account, you can do so here (this must be done from either a school computer or a personal device connected to the School Wireless Network). Your username is your student ID number (e.g. 12345). Your default password (if you have not changed it) is studentID + first 3 letters of birth month with the first letter capitalized (e.g. 12345Dec).  Once you have done this, you may access the form here. There is also a permanent link to the form in the 'Useful links' Intrabox.

At least 30 minutes of downtime is expected during this time period.  During this time, all TJHSST Services including email, Iodine, and the TJHSST Remote Access Server will be inaccessible. fields.name: AP Exams for nonenrolled students
fields.content: If you would like to take an AP exam and are not currently enrolled in the course. Follow these instructions:  Submit a check payable to TJHSST for $100 per exam On the memo line of the check, write your name and exam, on the top of your check your ID# Give this check to Mr. Wong, office A8 before March 22, or leave in an envelope in the box outside his office, or main office No refund for orders already placed If the exam you are requesting is in conflict with a regularly scheduled AP exam, you will take the requested exam during the AP exam makeup schedule and add $40 to the above exam fee for a total of $140 We do not offer the following exams for non enrolled students: Art History, Chinese, Human Geography, Italian and Russian. If you would like to possibly take them at another location, see Mr. Wong If you have further questions, see me, office A8, or email adam.wong@fcps.edu   Important links (dates): http://professionals.collegeboard.com/testing/ap/about/dates http://professionals.collegeboard.com/testing/ap/coordinate/late/schedule

Please make sure that your 8th period activity sign-ups for this Wednesday and Friday still accurately reflect which activities you wish to attend.  Andrew Hamilton TJ IT

fields.author: Andrew Hamilton

fields.name: Practice SAT and ACT on February 9
fields.content: Are you studying for the SAT or ACT? Come take practice SAT or ACT at 9am Saturday, February 9th, right here at TJ! The Thursday after the test, you will get a detailed breakdown of your score, including your strengths and weaknesses. Sign up and pay the $20 fee by February 8th online at https://www.applerouth.com/signup/?code=M93217. See one of our flyers for more information.
fields.author: Ethan Alexander Lowman

fields.name: Freshman Poll
fields.content: Due to renovation, having a full freshmen Lock in is not possible. However, the Freshmen Class Council still wants to have a class activity. In order to have your best interest at heart, we ask that you answer this poll ASAP so that we can plan an activity that you guys want to do. Please look at each option and choose an activity that you would enjoy having. If you have any comments or ideas for a different activity, please place them in the text area. When suggesting an idea, please keep in mind that the activity has to be able to be done by 450 people. The results and ideas of this poll will be read by the Freshmen Class Council members as well as the class sponsors.  Also, please keep in mind that final results are subject to finding an available venue, unless the option of having a Partial Lock in is chosen. The poll will close TOMORROW, Wednesday, January 23nd at 2:20PM.
fields.author: Andrew Hamilton

fields.name: Wanted:  TJ Students to host visiting Chinese students in February
fields.content: This exchange is sponsored by Ameson Education & Culture Exchange. The 15 visiting Chinese students are enrolled in Ameson American high school programs in China. The students were invited by TJ for a one-week home-stay exchange from Feb. 9th to Feb. 16th.   You don’t need to be in the TJ Chinese program in order to participate.  If you are interested in Chinese language and culture, and you would like to make some international connections, then become a host family and show the world our TJ pride.  *** We still need two families to host two boys and one family to host a girl.  Stipends will be provided to off-set the costs of hosting.  If you are sure that you are able to host a student, please contact Mrs. Xu (qxu1@fcps.edu) or Ms. Zhou (hzhao@fcps.edu) for more information.  If you can host a student, we will need you to provide the following information: your name, parent's name, parent's email address, home phone and cell phone numbers, home address, and school bus numbers(morning AM and afternoon PM).
fields.author: Andrew Hamilton

fields.name: tjTODAY Online Newspaper
fields.content: Hey Jefferson! Want to know about the current happenings at our school? Head on over to our online newspaper to read more about recent sorts events, student plays, eighth period clubs and more. And while you’re at it, make sure to like our Facebook page and follow us on Twitter at @tjtoday_news!

fields.name: Submit to Threshold (And Shadwell)!
fields.content: Threshold, TJ's very own Literary Magazine, needs your submissions  for the upcoming spring volumeHave you written any prose or poetry? Do you have any paintings, drawings, photography, original dramas, or original music scores that you'd like featured in Threshold? Follow the instructions on the form and place submissions in the box outside room 107 or in the main office! Submissions can also be emailed to thresholdlitmag@gmail.comThreshold Submission Form: http://bit.ly/W4i8UW Threshold submissions are due by Friday, January 18th! Get submitting!We are also accepting submissions for Shadwell: a prose and poetry contest sponsored by Threshold and judged by professional writers. This year the theme is "Seeds"! Shadwell Submissions are due January 25th!Submission forms for both Shadwell and Threshold can be found in folders in your English class and around the school!Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/tjthreshold?fref=ts

Donate any jeans that you don't wear anymore for an opportunity to help homeless teens and get service hours. Collection boxes are in front of the old library, in room 151, and in room 211. Don't forget to donate!

fields.content: Keep TJ Safe!  Please do not let anyone into the school building during the day.  If you see any adult without a badge/visitor pass, please report them to security or administration.  See something, say something.

Check out the info flier!

fields.content: Come see TJ's first ever Playwright's Workshop after-school this Friday at 4:30pm in the auditorium.  The shows, Statuesque and Catchphrase, are both student-written and student-directed.  Admission is free.  Don't miss out!

fields.content: Government Students:  Want to learn more about resources on test prep for learning AP Government?  Visit the library’s web pages for the RESEARCH PATHFINDER that lists them.  The library will present a special workshop to teach you how to use some of the most important resources from the list.  Sign up for Special Library Workshop for 8th period for Monday, January 14 in the Library Computer Classroom.

fields.name: Weekend Downtime
fields.content: Several TJ services (ns1 and mysql1) will be updated this weekend, which will result in downtime.ns1 will be updated on Saturday, Jan. 12, 2013 starting around 4:00 PM. Total maintenance time should be between 2 and 4 hours. ns1 should remain operational for most of the maintenance window.mysql1 will be updated on Sunday, Jan. 13, 2013 starting around 6:00 PM. Total maintenance time should be about 5 minutes, and mysql1 will not be operational during the maintenance window.

fields.name: TJ Active Minds -- First Meeting this Wed A Block!
fields.content: Do you remember  the recent presentation by Jordan Burnham? How about the recent Mental Wellness Week? And what about Stress Less, Laugh More from last year? Well, all this was brought to you by TJ Active Minds, a club focused on removing the stigma associated with mental illnesses. Come to our first club meeting THIS Wednesday A Block.See you there!
fields.author: Ethan Alexander Lowman

fields.name: New - Academic Business Club - Monday 8th Period
fields.content: The Thomas Jefferson Academic Business Club, abbreviated ABC, is a new 8th period club on Mondays! As stated in our name, we put emphasis on the academics of business: covering case studies, discussions, and lectures and presentations by both students and guests. If this sounds like something you'd like to check out, make sure to sign up for the next 8th period block!
fields.author: Andrew Hamilton

fields.name: Internet Downtime 1/4/2013
fields.content: Thank you for your patience in dealing with our unexpected Internet Outage earlier today.  The problem was due to a problem with the upstream router of that connects our student networks and TJHSST servers to the internet via the MATP router run by Virginia Tech. All issues have been resolved and all services are back online.  Andrew Hamilton Network / Systems Administrator
fields.author: Andrew Hamilton

fields.name: Come Watch your Teachers Dance!

fields.author: Andrew Hamilton

fields.name: Your library is now open!
fields.content: The library is now open in our new temporary location!  Visit us upstairs in the previous math hallway - the main library is in rooms 238-240, and across the hall you'll find the library's online room in rooms 242 A&B. Hours for the main library are 8 am to 4 pm, and the online classroom 7:45 am until 3:50 pm. We look forward to seeing you!
fields.author: Ethan Alexander Lowman

fields.name: Japanese High School Students Present Science Projects
fields.content: There will be a group of Japanese students visiting us on 1/9. They will be observing the STEM related classes in the morning.  They will be  presenting various science projects and school life during the 8th period (AB) in the lecture hall.  All presentations are given in English.  Some of the topics are:Developing a Safer Nail PolishResearching the Water QualitySilver Mirror Reaction without using AmmoniaResearch on the Magnus EffectResearch of light pollutionMathematical Patterns in Bach’s ConcertoThe Effect of Amylase on Sweet Potato and Potato
fields.author: Ethan Alexander Lowman

fields.name: Friday Pizza Sale Sponsored by SDI
fields.content: Come to the JLounge this Friday during break to buy pizza and support the Student Diversity Initiative! We will be selling pizza with a variety of toppings including Hawaiian, Sausage, Pepperoni, and Cheese!
fields.author: Ethan Alexander Lowman

fields.name: <font color="red">Winter Downtimes</font>
fields.content: On behalf of the TJHSST Student Systems Administrators, we hope you are enjoying your break. During break, we will be performing maintenance on various systems that support the operations of the Computer Systems Lab and services such as Iodine and the Remote Access Server.  Some of this maintenance will require that servers be rebooted or otherwise taken offline which may result in service disruptions.  We will be making every effort to provide at least 24 hours notice of any maintenance which may result in downtime. Notices will be provided as edits to this news posting, posted to our Downtimes page, and via other means appropriate to the services affected.  Thank you in advance for your patience as we perform these essential maintenance tasks. If you have any questions, please email ahamilto@tjhsst.edu.  Andrew Hamilton Network / Systems Administrator
fields.author: Andrew Hamilton

fields.name: Hear about an Antarctic adventure!
fields.content: TJ Bird Club will be hosting Mr. Hugh Powell on Wednesday, January 2 B-block! Mr. Powell is a science writer at Cornell University's Cornell Lab of Ornithology. He will be speaking about his recent expedition to Antarctica, conducting research on Adélie Penguins! If you have any questions about incorporating science and writing into the same career, Mr. Powell is an ideal person to meet and talk to. See you there!
fields.author: Andrew Hamilton

fields.name: Sweaters and Sweetness Spirit Day
fields.content: To celebrate the holidays, SGA is proud to present Sweaters and Sweetness Sprit Day! Wear a holiday-themed costume or ugly Christmas sweater on Friday and if you can find an SGA member during the day, we will give you a sweet holiday treat! Happy Winter Break!

fields.content: Looking for something to do before the world ends? Come to Action Africa's Holiday Party this Friday B-block, December 21! Take part in an African potluck, listen to African music and review the newsworthy events of the year. Sign up today!

fields.content: Hungry for sushi? Behind on Christmas shopping? Don't know where to go for the end of the world? Sign up for the Japanese New Year's Festival on December 21 for Japanese food, games, gifts, and a calligraphy performance!

fields.name: Middle School Leadership Conference Applications
fields.content: TJ will be hosting its 6th Annual Middle School Leadership Conference for local middle school students on Saturday, February 2nd. As a part of the Conference, we have 4-5 workshops that the students visit, all with different themes (past workshops include: Public Speaking, Planning an Event, Thinking on Your Feet, Leadership in Sports) that pertain to skills a good leader must have. Students can lead workshops individually or in small groups. If you are interested in leading a workshop, please turn in all completed forms to the Leadership Conference envelope on the door to Room 234 or email all completed forms to sga.tjhsst@gmail.com no later than Tuesday, January 8th at 11:59PM. fields.name: Ballroom Dance Club's I-Night Tryouts!
fields.content: Come try out for Ballroom Dance Club's Argentine Tango I-Night performance!  Tryouts will be held on Thursday, December 13th in T19 during lunch.  You can come learn the tryout routine at Ballroom during A block on Friday, December 7 or in T19 during lunch on Tuesday, December 11. A partner is not required, but highly recommended. We'll do our best to match you up with someone if you don't have a partner.If you are interested in trying out, please email Yana Kaplun (yanka872@gmail.com) with your name, your email, and whether you have a partner or not.If you are chosen to perform, please keep in mind that you will be committing to rehearsals during JLC, some lunches, and probably a few times after school as we get closer to the event.  We promise it'll be worth it :)Email Yana Kaplun (yanka872@gmail.com), Erika Rashka (erikar12345@gmail.com) or Valerie Nguyen (artichokegalore@gmail.com) if you have any questions!
fields.author: Ethan Alexander Lowman

fields.name: Exciting Leadership and Global Affairs Event-tjMUN Global!
fields.content: Are your siblings, friends, neighbors, or anyone else you know in elementary or middle school interested in current events, global affairs, or leadership? How about in hearing some distinguished guest speakers, such as the Executive Director of Human Rights in North Korea or the Deputy Head of Missions from the Netherlands?  If so, please tell them to head on over to the tjMUN Global, to be held on December 15th from 5 to 8:30. Over a dozen TJ clubs will be setting up educational booths, and there will be some awesome performances too! Food and fun for the whole family! And you can help too! Please sign up to volunteer, and you can get service hours and a whole lot of fun in the mix! Any questions, please contact TJ Model United Nations at tjmodelun@gmail.com.
fields.author: Ethan Alexander Lowman

fields.name: TJ Choir Presents "Sweeney Todd - The Demon Barber of Fleet Street" in Concert
fields.content: In May of 2011 we presented an unforgettable Les Misérables. In March of 2012 we put on a spectacular performance of The Secret Garden. And now get ready for yet another mind-blowing musical: TJ Choir's Sweeney Todd!!This production features the TJ Pit Orchestra and the TJ Faculty, Parent, and Alumni Choir. Performances are Friday, December 7th and Saturday, December 8th, both at 7:00 p.m. in the auditorium.  Tickets are $10 at the door.Come and support your friends and classmates in this extraordinary event!
fields.author: Ethan Alexander Lowman

fields.name: Music Production Club - Friday B Blocks!
fields.content: Interested in learning how to make electronic music? Already an experienced producer? Come to Music Production Club Friday B Blocks to listen, collaborate, practice, and learn the art behind all styles of produced music. All are welcome!

fields.content: On Wednesday, December 5th, A and B-block, TJ's language and culture clubs will be hosting a Winter Holiday Celebration. Activities (and free food!) will be provided by French, German, Spanish, Russian, Chinese, Japanese, Esperanto, and Arabic Language Clubs as well as the Jewish Culture Club and World Culture Club.

fields.name: Bioinformatics Society

fields.name: Birds! Cupcakes! Wednesday B block!
fields.content: Would you like to learn about the more than 300 wild bird species that can be seen in northern Virginia? Are you interested in going on bird walks and bird banding trips to observe these birds? Do you like Georgetown Cupcakes? Come to the first meeting of TJ’s newest 8th period club this Wednesday B-block (November 14)! We will learn about bird identification and behavior. Listen to guest speakers from the Cornell Lab of Ornithology, Smithsonian Migratory Bird Center, and Virginia Audubon! Participate in citizen science projects including eBird and bird banding—you might hold a live wild bird in your hand! Join local groups on half-day and full-day birding trips. No previous experience required! And last but not least, enjoy a Georgetown Cupcake at the club’s first meeting! If you have any questions, please send an email to sayedtwo@mac.com. Hope to see you there!

fields.name: Library Databases
fields.content: “No one’s asked me!” The short one was in hysterical tears. “It’s ‘Asking Week’ and NO ONE HAS ASKED ME!!!!!”  “Really?” responded the taller one.  “I’ve had at least 20 ‘asks’ and it’s been going on since September.” “Well, what am I doing wrong?”  “If you want some advice, maybe you should TELL THEM ON THE INTRANET that if they want to KNOW where the best place to start their research, they should just ASK A LIBRARIAN.” “Yeah, especially 10th graders, because they need a whole new set of databases for World History:  Salem World History, EBSCO, Proquest, J-STOR and our new e-book collection E-brary.” “If they only KNEW about these good places to start, they’d get their projects done faster, with better quality and have more time for the fun things in life, like Homecoming.” “I’m on it!” the short one exclaimed, tossing wet tissues away….

fields.content: The Computer Systems Lab currently has a surplus of "Itanium" servers. If you are interested and would like to take one of these servers, please come to the lab (Room 115) during lunch or 8th period and talk to an admin. fields.name: How to Sign up for Google Apps for Education
fields.content: Oh Hai!Some of your teachers may be using Google Apps for Education  in the coming days and months. For your teacher to be able to use Google Apps for Education with you, you'll need to sign up for the FCPS specific Google Apps for Education. The FCPS Google Apps for Education are set up so that you can only share and collaborate with folks with their FCPS accounts. That means that you won't be able to access those document with any other Google account. Yes, that includes your own, personal G-Mail account. That might seem a little wonky at first, but it's done so that all students in FCPS have a happy and safe place to learn. So its done out of care and concern! For you!Here is how to get set up:1) Go to the TJ Library Course found in Blackboard2) The main menu (on the left) will have a Google Apps Button. Select the button.3) On this page, you will see an option to ACTIVATE your account. Select this option.4) Enter your FCPS network USERNAME and PASSWORD. The username is your Student ID number and it is the same info you use to get on FCPS mobile.5) You'll be prompted to create a password for your new Google Apps account. You may want to use the same password as your Blackboard account. Just a suggestion to make your life easier. You'll need to type the new password twice. I'm sure you know the drill.6) Viola! You'll be prompted to log in to your shiny new account. You might want to bookmark that log in page so that you can find it more easily in the future.

fields.name: Survey to establish priorities for TJ goals
fields.content: During the 2011-2012 school year Thomas Jefferson High  School for Science and Technology went through an accreditation review  through Advanced Ed, formerly known as SACS.  The evaluation was  excellent, where we were recognized at the highest level of performance  in all review categories.  A summary of reports and recommendations  gathered by our action plan team can be accessed at the following  website:  http://www.tjhsst.edu/~emglazer/reports/  We realize there is always room for improvement and growth in our  programs and management, and at this point we are interested in hearing  from our community on how we should prioritize our improvement efforts  over the next five years.  Please take 10-15 minutes to respond to the  following survey to offer your input:  http://www.surveymonkey.com/s/JJ7C3VK  Thank you for offering your recommendations by June 4.

fields.name: Programme for International Student Assessment
fields.content: Congratulations!  You are one of 150 TJ students who have been selected at random to take part in the Programme for International Student Assessment, the PISA.  The PISA will be administered Thursday May 10, 2012 at TJ from 8:30 am – 11:30 am in the TJ cafeteria.   TJ is one of five Fairfax County Public Schools and approximately thirty schools nation-wide who have been selected to participate in this assessment.   It is important that each student selected take part in the assessment. Each time a selected student does not participate, the accuracy of the results for the school may suffer. I urge you to support this effort.  It goes without saying that all of the information collected is completely confidential, including the results.  Individual students results will not be reported – only school-wide data. In fact, the study is required to do so by law.   Information on the PISA test can be found here.   Contact Dr. Heather Sondel, Assistant Principal with questions or concerns, in Room 229A.  UPDATE: New information – students are allowed to use calculators and rulers. Please bring your calculator and pencils to the cafeteria.  You will check-in in the cafeteria; attendance will be taken.

fields.name: Transportation Survey
fields.content: Dear TJ community,  In preparation for the 2012-2013 school year, we are exploring the possibility of depot busing as an option to those Fairfax County students who do not wish to be picked up from their home or from their local base school. We do not plan to eliminate any of the current routes, but instead consider redistributing buses where there might be a greater demand.  For example, suppose your base high school is Westfield, but it’s more convenient to take the bus from Chantilly high school since it might be on route to a work destination. By default, you are assigned to the Westfield bus, but we would actually prefer to assign you to a Chantilly bus if there is available space. If demand is really high at one school, we would investigate an additional bus at that location. To assist us in our planning, if you are a Fairfax County Resident, please answer this survey no later than May 18th.  Thank you for your cooperation.  Sincerely,  Evan Glazer Principal, TJHSST

fields.content: APUSH, Global Topics and Am History students - make YOUR WRITING on history look good, detailed and well supported with statistics! fields.name: Sign the Petition to Put Solar Panels Back on the White House
fields.content: Sign the Environmental Impact Club's petition to put solar panels back on the White House! As many of you know, TJ installed 22 solar panels on our roof a few years ago due to EIC's efforts. If we can do it, the White House should be able to too!  Solar panels were first installed on the White House in 1979 by President Jimmy Carter, but were taken down by President Ronald Reagan just seven years later. President Obama must put solar panels back on the roof to show that America is ready for a clean energy economy and that his administration is willing to lead the nation in this effort. Although President Obama promised on October 5, 2010 to have solar panels and a solar water heater on the roof by summer 2011, there has been no action whatsoever. He must follow through on his promise immediately in order to send a message to the world that the United States is ready to lead the clean energy revolution.  Please sign the Change.org petition here.  With a starting goal of 500 signatures, we can increase our efforts from there and really make a difference!  - Environmental Impact Club

fields.name: Come to Forensic Science Society Friday A Blocks!
fields.content: Are you interested in crime scenes, solving cases, and  watching cool TV shows? More importantly, do you love food? If so, then  you should come to Forensics Science Society, which meets B-Block in Dr.  Del Cerro's room (room 123) every other Friday.  At FSS, we learn about forensics science techniques  involving biology, chemistry, and physics. These include topics like  blood splatter, fingerprinting, voice analysis, and criminal psychology.  Many times, we have lab experiments where you can get hands-on  experience with these crime-scene investigation techniques. We also  watch TV shows like Bones and play jeopardy!   Don't forget the food! When we say we have food, we mean it. Every week, our officers bring in food to share with you guys! So come on and join the fun at FSS!

fields.name: How to get on FCPS Mobile
fields.content: FCPSmobile is a high-capacity network that is now available for you to use. If you frequently bring in a personal laptop or other device, this is what you need to know in order to get onto the network:1)From the network selection menu, select FCPSmobile.2) You will get an alert saying that the connection attempt could not be completed. Select the Connect option.3)When you get the prompt for Network Authentication, type fcpsedu [backslash]  USERNAME. Enter your password using the following conventions:Username: Your Student ID NumberPassword: Your Student ID Number & initials (first, middle-if you have one-last name)(We've noticed that Apple products won't require the 'fcpsedu' before the USERNAME, so if you did the above and it didn't work, try it without the 'fcpsedu'. Yeah, I know. It's confusing.) 4)You may be be prompted to change your password.

fields.name: Inform the future of education via the JOSTI Educational Enhancement through Technology Grant!
fields.content: Like to try out new tools, apps and ideas? Want to present your ideas on how to best use technology to international teachers?  If so, apply for the 2012 JOSTI Educational Enhancement through Technology Grant.  The purpose of the JOSTI Educational Enhancement through Technology Grant is to provide teachers and students the opportunity to explore a technology that may enhance learning or improve instruction. Approved applicants will be provided up to $1000 to complete the work. All work must be centered around and take place inside of an educational setting during the current school year. Grant recipients will be expected to give a presentation or demonstration at the Jefferson Overseas Schools Technology Institute 2012 Conference (June 25th to 29th, 2012), a conference sponsored by the US State Department and held at TJ every June for Educators and Technology Support Staff from American Overseas Schools.  The online application form can be found here and must be submitted by November 22nd. If you have any questions, please contact Aron Sterling at amsterling@fcps.edu.

fields.name: About Telelearning-November 23
fields.content: Dear TJ community,I am writing to let you know about a telelearn day on Wednesday, November 23, where students will be learning from home instead of coming to school.For the last several years, many Americans have been telecommuting to work on an occasional basis, working away from their physical workplace.  Advantages of telecommuting include increased flexibility in the use of time, cost savings, and environmental sensitivity with fewer cars on the road.  A telelearn day should have similar benefits to teleworking and also provides the school an opportunity to test a remote learning system in the event of an emergency that would close school.~~Dr. Glazer

fields.name: TJ IT Survey
fields.content: As part of TJ's upcoming renovation, the TJ Partnership Fund is coordinating a workshop in late July that will bring together IT industry executives and alumni to map out the school's IT infrastructure for the foreseeable future. In order for Workshop participants to have a full picture of TJ’s IT needs, we seek your ideas and suggestions for future computing, collaboration and network capabilities. This is a rare opportunity to help shape the next generation of IT equipment and services, so please let us know what's missing in TJ's IT infrastructure and imagine TJ's advanced research facility in the near future.  You can find the survey at http://www.surveymonkey.com/s/BMQH7TF.  If you have additional comments or questions, please email ahamilto@tjhsst.edu  A sampling of winning entries will be posted at the end of next week. Please complete the survey before midnight Monday, June 20.  Thanks for your time and ideas!  TJ Partnership Fund

fields.name: World IPv6 Day
fields.content: All - June 8th is World IPv6 Day.  On this day, many organizations including Google, Facebook, Akamai, and TJ are offering their content over IPv6 as a test for the eventual transition from IPv4 to IPv6.  IPv6 is the next generation of internet addressing system with support for 2^128  unique addresses.  TJ has native IPv6 connectivity through our connection to the Internet 2 backbone and many of our services are IPv6-enabled.  Therefore, you should not have any problems accessing participating sites from TJ during this test.  For more information on IPv6, you can check out Hurricane Electric's website at http://tunnelbroker.net/ or email Andrew Hamilton at ahamilto@tjhsst.edu.
fields.author: Andrew Hamilton

fields.name: Summer Chemistry Info Session!
fields.content: Hey current freshmen, taking summer chem? Scared of failing this class? THEN COME TO CHEMISTRY SOCIETY THIS FRIDAY (6/10) B-BLOCK TO FIND OUT WHAT YOU CAN DO TO GET AN A IN THIS CLASS!  Please sign up now because the openings for this block are limited! If you don't sign up then you will get an A- or lower guaranteed. No, like actually. You don't want to be one of those students that never knew that you were supposed to memorize your polyatomic ions or solubility guidelines. SIGN UP NOW!

fields.name: May 27 Telelearn at TJHSST
fields.content: Friday, May 27, for periods 5, 6 and 7, students will be learning from home instead of coming to school using some of our technology resources.  The structure will be block periods, like a typical Red Day, but without 8th period.  This telelearn day not only conserves time, money, and the environment, it is also an opportunity to test a remote learning system in the event of an emergency that would close school.  Learning activities will be structured in a variety of ways based on each teacher’s specifications described to students in class in advance of May 27.  Internet access and a computer will be important for this day because teachers post learning resources to Blackboard, our online course management system, and some will require synchronous text or video chat.  If you do not have access to Internet from home, please consider going to a friend’s house or your local library. If you would prefer your child to work in the school library, you can drop them off by 8:30 or you can request transportation from Bob McCormick (RDMcCormick@fcps.edu or 703-750-8331) by May 20.  If you have any questions about this day, please don’t hesitate to email the principal, Dr. Evan Glazer, at Evan.Glazer@fcps.edu

fields.name: JOSTI 2001 Tech Grant
fields.content: The purpose of the JOSTI Technology Grant is to provide teachers and students with an opportunity to explore new technologies that enhance learning and/or teaching in the classroom. Approved applicants will be provided funding for a technology tool (up to $1,000 in value) that must be applied to the educational setting for the remainder of the school year. Grant recipients will be expected to give a presentation or demonstration at the JOSTI 2011 Conference (June 27-July 1, 2011) at TJHSST, in a session intended to illustrate the educational benefits and classroom applications of the technologies. Students are encouraged to pursue technologies and applications that might enhance the learning experience by engaging, challenging and supporting students and teachers alike. An application form is available online that must be submitted by February 28, 2011. Contact either barbara.dent@fcps.edu or richard.washer@fcps.edu with any questions.

fields.name: Survey on Honors Weighting
fields.content: From Dr. Glazer:Over the last two weeks, I have held several meetings with different groups (students, teachers, administrators, and parents) to discuss the potential benefits and limitations to different honors weighting options at TJ.  There is not any perfect solution, so this information provided an awareness of the complexity of this challenge we face together.  Thank you for taking valuable time to be part of these discussions.  I would now like you to provide your preference in a survey, located at this website:http://www.surveymonkey.com/s.aspx?sm=gNvc6LBPnPX2pZtE9388zA_3d_3dThe survey provides you notes from each of the meetings so you can understand the different perspectives across our community. Please respond by December 6, 2009.  The survey data will be reportedat the December PTSA meeting and also on the TJ Intranet, and a recommendation will be forwarded to the superintendent before the endof the 1st semester.  Thank you for contributing your thoughts to this very important topic in our community.

fields.name: One Book Discussion Leaders
fields.content: Dear Seniors,Please sign-up to be a One Book Discussion Leader.  National Honor Society will grant you community service hours for your work.  We will be meeting this Thursday (9/16) at 8:30 during JLC in the Lecture Hall.  We will provide you with all of the information you will need then.  Here's what the job will look like:1. You read Brave New World (hopefully you're doing that anyway).2. You attend a meeting on 9/16 where we will supply you with discussion questions, discussion guidelines -- everything you need.3. You lead the discussion and take notes on student responses on 10/12.Sign up under Polls, 'One Book Sign-up'.

fields.name: CSL Outage Update
fields.content: Most CSL Services should be back online after the earlier power outage.  However, based on current elevated lab temperatures, it appears that the restoration surge might have blown a fuse in the CSL AC Unit.  As a result, we are currently running services on a reduced number of machines until we can restore full cooling capacity or put alternative cooling into place.  The Postman calendar system (postman.tjhsst.edu) is also still down at this time and will likely not be back until monday.  Thank you in advance for your patience.  --The Sysadmins

fields.name: Forensics Science Society: Lip print Analysis
fields.content: What does your lip print say about you? This Wednesday, B Block, the Forensics Science Society is doing Lip Print Analysis. We will take your lip print and then analyze the common types of lip prints and how they are formed. We will examine when lip prints been used to solve a case and finally examine what your lip print reveals about your personality. There will be cake, cookies, and drinks! Girls, please bring your own lipstick.

fields.content: A block Friday, February 15th sophomores and juniors sign up to learn about the Keystone Youth Policy Summit to be held in Keystone, Colorado this summer from August 2-9. They will create innovative policies compiled into a set of recommendations and shared with members of Congress, state departments of education, government agencies and thought leaders in the industrial and non-profit sectors.

fields.content: TJHSST students are invited to participate in the National PTA Reflections Program for 2008-2009. The theme for the 2008-2009 Reflections Program is "Wow!".  TJHSST PTSA will be accepting entries October 16 and October 17 in the school office.  The deadline for submitting an entry is October 17.  For more information, entry forms and instructions, select the Reflection tab on www.novadistrictpta.org, or contact Denise Bolton at fairfaxartsined@gmail.com.

fields.name: <font color=red>TAP: Moderators Welcome Back</font>
fields.content: Meng: The 2007-2008 school year has started, and it is necessary to finish the projects from last year ASAP. Biology and Chemistry ought to be finished before spring break. William: As you have probably noticed, TAP has been migrated! It is now running in its own virtual server. A consequence of this is that we are now running the latest and greatest MediaWiki software. Wonderful. Why do you care? Since things are actually considered stable now, and more stuff has been made secure, here are the two biggest things you need to know: 1) Embedded images that link to external websites are no longer displayed. Please note that it is good practice (and it is now required) that you upload the picture into TAP. If the image disappears from or is changed on the other website, we will not be affected. However, you are still REQUIRED to place a citation for the image. Also, uploading the image to TAP means that, by viewing the page, a person doesn't have to connect to any other servers (in this case, less servers = more secure). 2) Lead moderators are responsible for ensuring their AP pages are working. If there is a major issue, please contact William Yang to see if there is an easy fix. Un/fortunately, by migrating the wiki to a correctly configured server, AP French Language is a bit broken again. The accents are weird if you look at them in the All pages list (so whatever was used for the very first time the pages were created, go back to that).

fields.content: To enhance the security of remotely accessing library databases from home, some changes to the border proxy server will be made. Firefox and other users should not be affected by this change, and will be able to use either address.  From now (1/22) until 1/26, both addresses should work for all users.  Note that after the change, both addresses will offer the same level of security, but we encourage you to use the new address to reduce confusion.If you are using the proxy script (proxy.pac) as described here, no changes will need to be made.If you have any questions, please contact William Yang (wyang@tjhsst.edu) or Richard Washer (rcwasher@tjhsst.edu).

fields.name: H1N1 Vaccinations
fields.content: FYI: H1N1 clinics this weekTuesday, December 1:  Vaccine is free of charge and available on a walk-in basis to the first 400 people in the CDC target groups at each of the five Health Department clinic locations (except for Springfield, which has a capacity for 350) between  8:00 a.m. â€“ 4:30 p.m.  Vaccine will be offered to: Pregnant women People who live with or provide care for infants younger than 6 months (parents, siblings and day care providers) Health care workers who have direct patient contact People 6 months through 24 years of age People 25 years through 64 years of age who have certain medical conditions that put them at higher risk for influenza-related complications. Â·  Thursday, December 3:   Vaccine is available free of charge and available on a walk-in basis to the first 400* people in CDC target groups at four Health Department Clinic locations (Herndon, Fairfax, Springfield, and Mt. Vernon) between  8:00 a.m. â€“ 4:30 p.m.  * Springfield District Office has capacity for 350 peopleThe Falls Church clinic will be open 12 p.m. - 7 p.m. on Dec. 3. Vaccine will distributed in two shifts. It wil be provided to the first 350 people starting at noon and the first 250 people starting at 5:00 p.m. (600 total for the day). What You Can Expect at the H1N1 Clinics Download Consent Forms and Read Vaccine Information Statement The CDC recommends all children through 9 years of age receive two doses of H1N1 vaccine separated by 4 weeks (28 days or more). Learn more about the second dose and what you need to bring.

There are 200 extra seats that are available for individual sign-up:Seniors:  You may sign up beginning Wednesday morning.  Sign up early because seats are limited.Underclassmen:  You may sign up to hear US Secretary of Education beginning Friday morning for any seats that may still be available.
fields.author: Richard Washer

fields.name: tjSTAR Day Is Coming!
fields.content: By May 22, sign up on the Intranet for four sessions at tjSTAR on May 28, 2009 â€“ the Symposium to Advance Research at TJHSST.  Not sure how to sign up? See the instructions on the tjSTAR web site.There is a lot to choose from on this day!  You can visit research presentations from senior tech labs, IBET, and CHUM to learn about projects.  In addition to viewing student work, you can attend interactive workshops from teachers, presentations from expert scientists, panel sessions with VIPs to connect science in society, hands-on design competitions, and high-tech demonstrations of innovative technologies and simulations from our partners in the gymnasium.  Examples of technology demos in the gymnasium include:Sprockit the robot from SAO RoboticsTeam Defend cyber security from SAICRobots from the CIA3D 2nd Life Virtual World from CSCISF Modeling from Lockheed MartinVirtual Intelligence Coordination Center (VICC) from Lockheed MartinTJHSST CubeSat from Energy Systems LabFuel Cell Vehicle from GMThermal Weapon Sight from US ArmyNight Vision Goggles from US ArmyMicrosoft touch table from Northrop GrummanRobobaws from Lockheed Martin5th gear robotics from Lockheed MartinImmersica from Lockheed MartinOur day will wrap up with a presentation from Secretary of Education, Arne Duncan, the top education official in the country.  Student can sign up individually to attend in the auditorium or will watch with their TAs in their classroom.
fields.author: Richard Washer

fields.name: JOSTI 2010 Grants
fields.content: Up to six JOSTI grants are available to students and teachers interested in researching and experimenting with new and emerging technologies that are relevant to education and the classroom. Grants of $1,000.00 dollars or more are available that will cover the cost of the technology and relevant licenses required for the technology. In order to be awarded the grant applicants must be willing to present on their findings at next year's JOSTI conference to be held June 28 through July 2, 2010. Further details are available online or please contact Mr. Washer for further information. Note that the deadline for this grant is November 8, 2009 and not the date posted in a prior document.

fields.name: Fairfax County Youth Leadership Program: Interest Meeting And Application Process
fields.content: The Fairfax County Youth Leadership Program is a national award winning program, sponsored by Fairfax County, that brings together on a monthly basis, two students, competitively selected, from each Fairfax County High School, with Fairfax County government leaders, to observe, discuss, and learn about local government.  A summer internship working for a government official, with a stipend of $1000, is an integral part of this program.  Program meets monthly, usually the fourth Wednesday of each month, at 3pm.  This offers an opportunity to meet, get to know, and work with County leaders as well as top notch students from each of the other high schools in Fairfax.  Participants are competitively selected by a selection committee.  Deadline for application is October 31.  You must (1) be a junior and (2) reside in Fairfax County to be eligible.  An interest meeting will be held during A Block on October 17, or see Mr. Torrence (T-3) for an information brochure and application.

fields.name: CSL System Update
fields.content: We have received word from the county that they have had to order replacement parts for the AC Unit and it will hopefully be fixed either Tuesday or Wednesday.  At the moment, we currently have all services functioning at reduced capacity.  Thank you in advance for your continued patience.  --The Sysadmins.
fields.author: Andrew Hamilton

fields.name: CSL System Status
fields.content: Due to a failure of the CSL Machine Room AC Unit, we are currently consolidating production services onto fewer machines in an attempt to maintain an operational environment for the servers.  As a result, some systems may be running a little slower.  At this point, we are making every effort to keep all production services online but it remains to be seen how long it will take for this problem to be resolved.  As a result of the higher temperatures, we are also having some intermittent stability issues.  We are sorry in advance for any disruptions and thank you for your patience.  We will continue to provide status updates as we get more information.
fields.author: Andrew Hamilton

fields.name: TJHSST SSL Certificate Warnings
fields.content: All - Starting this evening, when accessing any TJHSST Service using HTTPS/SSL, it is likely that you will get a certificate error.  This is due to the Top Level signing certificate expiring and the new one not yet being included in most browsers.  We are working on instructions to manually install the new Top Level Certificate; for now Firefox, Opera, and Chrome are known to be affected.  IE has a certificate update that was put out in November that should be installed (this is an optional update and will not be installed automatically).  We will publish more details as we get them.  If you have any questions please email sysadmins@lists.tjhsst.edu.  Thank you in advance for your patience.--The Sysadmins

fields.name: Research Symposium Title Sought
fields.content: May 28, 2009, an all day event will take place to share student research projects and learn about future research opportunities at TJ and in potential careers.  The symposium also serves as an opportunity for students to inspire each other with new ideas for study in future years, obtain feedback from their peers, and involve alumni and community partners in our academic programs.  The student presentations / demonstrations will include IBET, Senior Projects, and the Mentorship Program.  In addition to student presentations, a variety of other activities including speakers, a panel / debate with outside experts, interactive experiment stations, and a research career fair will be part of this culminating experience.  Please contact Koji Otani (koji.otani@fcps.edu) if you have a great name that represents the idea of this event by 10/31.
